resources.string: Welcome to the University of Eastern Philippines. The first state universiy in Visayas where students are develop into academically competitive individuals prepared to take over the reigns of leadership. UEP warmly welcomes you to its campus. \nWe congratulate you for your decision to proceed to college and secure your future. We assure you that you had your best choice of a school which you would expect to mold you and your character to become not only the best individuals in your future careers, but life winners who will be assets in making the society a better place to live in.

The official seal of the University was registered with the Intellectual Property Office of the Philippines on August 1, 2013 with Registration No. 4/2013/00002186. The seal's design is show below. 
Blue and Gold colors - the University colors symbolize the lofty ideals of the institution and the golden dreams of the youth. 
Wheel - symbolizes the unending search for knowledge. 
Lamp - symbolic of the light that education brings. 
Sun's Eight Rays - indicate Region 8 (Eastern Visayas), the immediate service area of the University. 
The words Instruction, Research, Extension, Production - refer to the quadruple functions of the University. 
The year 1918 - the establishment of the institution as the Catarman Farm School which later became the Catarman National Agricultural High School (CANHS). 
The year 1956 - the establishment of the Samar Institute of Technology (SIT) and the abolition of CANHS on Jne 14, 1956 by virtue of Republic Act 1434. 
The year 1964 - the conversion of SIT into the University of Eastern Philippines (UEP) on June 20, 1964 by virtue of Republic Act 4126.
A globally competitive university producing graduates in pursuit of higher economic welfare of the people and the community through inclusion and cooperation from the stakeholders.
Provide technical and professional training, advanced instruction in literature, arts, philosophy, the sciences and promotion of innovation, scientific and technological researches.

R Relevance. All our plans and actions must be relevant to UEP's vision and mission. 
I Integrity. Honest beyond reproach, respected, trustworthy, and admired. Public officers and employees must at all times be accountable to te people, serve them with utmost responsibility, integrity, loyalty, and efficiency, act with patriotism and justice, and lead modest lives. 
P Productivity. Our output must always be equal to if not greater than the investment of the National Government. 
E Excellence. Our work must always wield beyond the average. It is the result of the right mix of knowledge, skills, and attitude.

Let us sing to you, oh UEP 
Sing the blue of your sea 
The green of your mountains 
The grain in your fields 
The harvest in your groves 

Let us sing to you, dear UEP 
Sing of your children fair 
The knowledge you share 
The values you instill 
The service you render 

Onward, forevermore, UEP 
God's grace be upon you 
His mighty hands protect and guide you 
As you face challenges 
Turn them 'to opportunities 
And your founders' dream pursue 

So we sing this hymn to you 
Of praise and gratitude 
Beloved Alma Mater 
Keep your blue and gold soaring 
Our found of wisdom, joy and hope 
Unsullied loyalty we do pledge 
Unsullied loyalty we do pledge 

Music by Rev. Fr. Eleno A. Delizon 
Lyrics by Dr. Lydia P.E. dela Rosa

Hi there! "My Tagahanap" is a mobile application that we developed specifically for the University of Eastern Philippines Main Campus to help the user (students/faculty/staff) find a specific area/building by providing an optimal path that is displayed on map. This would lessen people asking for assistance to strangers when they need to find the room of their class, location of their meeting or orientation for which new comers are not familiar with. I hope you enjoy your stay here in the campus with your trusty app, My Tagahanap!
Long click the text below and save it somewhere safe. It will be used for resetting password.
